subject: Self Care
title: The Flow Channel
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Flow Channel.

hook.text: Too easy and you're bored. Too hard and you're anxious. Flow lives in the narrow channel between the two extremes.

buildup.text: The flow channel requires the task to be about 4% harder than your current skill level. Enough stretch to engage, not overwhelm.

discovery.text: As skills grow, you must increase challenge to stay in flow. Stagnation kills flow. Growth sustains it.

twist.text: This is why video games are addictive â€” they adjust difficulty to keep you in the flow channel. Real life doesn't do that for you.

climax.text: Be your own game designer. When work feels too easy, add a constraint. Too hard, break it down. Calibrate your own flow.

punchline.text: Calibrate challenge to skill. Flow lives in the stretch zone.

quiz.question: Why are video games so effective at producing flow?
options: They automatically adjust difficulty to match your skill level
